Sentence:
Hey Canon,

I have a PIXMA MX922 that is installed as required by you and will NOT sent faxes.
Every time I get Error Reports it waste ink, and as you well know, the ink is not cheap.
Just purchased the printer, and I've some questions: (1) where is the user manual?; (2) can I print from the top tray?
I've tried to print from the top tray, and it doesn't seem to be working; (3) is there a way that I can print envelopes without having to unload the cassette?
Great printer - setup a little difficult - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) The printer is good.
My only complaint is that setting it up for a wireless network was a long and involved process.
If setup had been easier, I'd have given five stars.

Want it to be Great, But Setup is Very Trying - Canon Office Products MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Received this past Friday, and have spent the better part of all weekend trying to get both Cloud and WiFi printing to work.
Cloud printing is finally working on the the kid's 3 Chromebooks, and on my HP Win7 Laptop, but WiFi printing on my laptop is not working.
The links you are directed to follow on the Cloud print setup lead you to circular dead-ends on the Canon website, getting you nowhere.
Lots of videos and whatnot on how great Cloud printing is, but nothing useful on the setup.

I finally went straight to the Printer interface and registered the printer on the Cloud from there, using the URL sheet it prints out, and manually connected it to my Router (WBS auto connect/setup would not work after trying for 2 hours).

I had one of the kids be the Cloud Printer owner on their Chromebook (as the URL registration failed each time via my HP laptop), then share the Printer with me, giving me at least Cloud printing access on my HP laptop.
WiFi set up fails every time, and I've done it a dozen times, wiping the Printer from my HP laptop before starting over each time.
I've tried to find the Printer by name, by IP address, etc. and it will not see it through my Router from my HP laptop; at a loss.
So for now, I cannot print directly from Word, Excel, etc to the Printer over WiFi, which is a bit annoying.

Quality Printing - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I only gave 4 stars, because it is somewhat slow and also seems to lose the wireless connection a lot.
Got a great deal from Amazon - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I had a Canon MP600 prior to purchasing Canon Pixma MX922.
However, when Amazon offered this printer for $99 I couldn't pass up on this deal - typically the price of the MX922 ranges from $130 - $159.
The wireless setup did not go as smooth as I had hope and eventually I had to call Canon Support for assistance.
Ipads are able to print to the MX922 which is a plus.
I am not an expert on color imaging but for me the color pages are good enough for me.
I read a review which mentioned how noisy the printer was and I was kind of skeptical of this review however after owning this printer it is true.
The MX922 is noisy for a printer.

Also, the ink cartridges for this printer are a little bit pricey for what I am use to but I do not print a whole lot so I am not that concerned with the price but should be considered if you plan on doing alot of printing.

Loosing WLAN Connection after 1-2 hours inactivity (sleep mode) - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) When the printer goes to sleep mode it looses WLAN connection, WLAN setting list --> Connection = Inactive.
Temporary Solution is OFF, ON Printer, takes a lot of time and the ink goes without printing anything.

THIS PRINTER IS SLOW AND HUGE FOR NO REASON - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) For a higher priced printer you'd expect it to be better, but it's alright.
People say it's slow during initial start up, no it's a turtle compared to my old lexmark.
You can't print either from the top or bottom paper tray.
Air print sounds awesome, but you still have to come back home and wake up the printer before it prints, so it defeats the purpose of printing anywhere.
Haven't had to change the ink yet.
Quality of printing is superb.
- Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Received my first machine and was unable to run the set-up menu.
The set-up is not without a challenge.
Have not set-up the Fax at this time, but read in an other review, that it will be able to be used with a VOIP phone connection.
Will follow up at a later time on the Fax set up.
Next time I'll buy an HP at least those work!

Printer offline errors and get ready to spend $$$ on replacement cartridges - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I've had this about a year and a half now.
I have a mac, and I run a business.
I had troubling installing the printer wirelessly.
Good printer - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) A good printer for the price.
It makes alot of noise when 1st turn on, but runs like champ.
Then I thought well maybe Google Cloud print would work better, so I got that set up.
Then suddenly nothing would print and Google cloud print said my printer was offline.

Not only did Google cloud print say the printer was offline, when I went to the control panel on the printer and selected the thing that is supposed to connect to Google cloud print and fetch print jobs, the printer said it couldn't connect to the internet - even though the printer was connected via Ethernet cable and I knew I had working internet.
Since it was connected to the network via Ethernet cable I thought, well, maybe it will work better if I connect it wireless.
So I unplugged the Ethernet cable and set the printer to connect to the wireless network.
But Canon's network tool on my laptop could not find the printer and it could not print at all.
But my printer is still offline to Google cloud print and still says it can't connect to the internet.
Both samples have failed to reliably connect to wi-fi.
I have two access points available in my home, and wi-fi printing is completely useless with either.
The printer's on screen diagnostics randomly report connected or disconnected status.
When it finally does print, it is extremely slow and spends on absurd amount of time making noise, before and after printing pages.

Canon PIXMA does not receive faxes well - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I bought this all in one Canon Pixma based on the excellent reviews and great price.
I returned the machine and bought an HP instead.
I believe the feed mechanism inside the machine is damaging the paper on the way through.
We particularly like the autofeeder for the scanner/copier, and it has a large capacity paper tray.
The printer installed very easily on our wireless network, and was similarly easy to install via USB.
I usually use it in draft mode, which saves ink, but the output is still pretty good.
2) Color printing is very good.
I am also a photographer, and the prints you get are acceptable.
Of course if you want the best, you have to go with one of the high end Epson's.
Printing in full up mode produces excellent quality printing.
3) Set up was a breeze.
7) It is pretty quiet.
Certainly quieter than the laser printer I have at home.
2) The paper tray is very small.
3) It uses ink pretty fast.
Aside: Canon's ink cartridges are very expensive.
I opted to by this third party set: The ink quality appears to be the same as Canon's, and and a considerably reduced price.
The wireless hook-up didn't work for me, and I don't have time to play around with it.
The printer is pretty noisy.
Print quality is ok, but I don't think the color quality is exceptional (I will rely on my Epson for that, but I pay a small fortune for the Epson replacement cartridges).
I was looking for a printer which had reasonably-priced replacement cartridges, didn't take up a lot of room, and was reliable.
HP, I have to say, is great quality when it works.
Pros: No problems hooking up with Mac OSX 10.7.5 No problems with wireless No problems printing from external computer or ipad Cons: -Would spool and not print intermittently.
This would not happen all the time- just intermittently, Wifi: same problem- Ethernet hook up same problem; direct USB printer cable- same problem--so it was not the connection.

The actual printing was relatively quick - it was the waiting of the processing of the printer (the processing your page with bonus noise included for 5 minutes to print one black and white document page. -Paper jam central. 1 jam to every 10 pages without fail. -1/2 the ink left and streaking on margins -print would come out off set on occasions. (like one spot higher than the other) -Alignment- cleaning etc--PLEASE.

Doesn't wake up well - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I did a lot of investigating into which printer to buy that would work with my IMac and iPad.
It worked well wirelessly with my iPad but would not work wirelessly with my iMac that was 12 inches away.
Once I hard wired it to the iMac it stopped working wirelessly with my iPad.

Easy set up, great performance great quality of images - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Customer review from the Amazon Vine™ Program (What's this?)
In any event, it was super easy to connect to my PC and start printing.
We used the scanner, found that to be very intuitive and the quality of image was good if not great.
If you are looking for a good all in one, that is outstanding with photos, this is a perfect choice.
Very easy setup for wifi and fax operation.
No problems at all with using any features via wifi.
The only issues I have with the printer is during an idle period it makes a lot of clicking/clattering sounds - perhaps going through a self-check or maintenance cycle.
Print and scan quality very good.
Had much better experiences with HP and Epson in the past.

Easy setup, fast scanning, nice color printing. - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) This all-in-one was bought to replace a Canon Pixma MP530.
The printer wireless setup went flawlessly on all of my PC's.

My old MP530's MP Navigator software, which was very functional and easy to configure, has been replaced with IJ Scan Utility which is difficult to setup and has some features which they user cannot change (e.g. it automatically puts a time stamp on all scans regardless of what I name the file - which according to tech support cannot be disabled).
Overall this unit does all I want, fast scanning, stunning color graphics - at a reasonable price.
Canon CANNOT repair it, they tell you that out of the kindness of their heart, they will SELL YOU a REPLACEMENT -- at a price higher than you find on Amazon (which price includes free shipping).
However, it is fast, quiet and doesn't seem to use that much ink.
I have had no issues setting it up on my home network.

The CD printing is a bit complicated - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) This is a great printer, very nice color and image quality, the set up and wi fi capabilities are up there, I got it because is able to print CDs, it does, however, is a bit tricky to learn to do this, once you get it is not a big deal, but is slow while printing CDS.

great printer - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I was overwhelmed with trying to set it up, but it turned out to be much easier than I thought!
Replaces my old HP which I will never use THAT brand again.
Great price, and you can get an extended warranty with it.
Tested against the Canon MG5420 and against the Epson 810 and HP 8600 using plain inkjet paper (not multipurpose copy paper).
All were pretty good, but weren't as good as my old HP Photosmart had been when it was brand new.
Printers, like everything else, are being engineered junkier and junkier as they drive down price and add gee-whiz features.
Print quality is nearly flawless.
Is it using much more ink, or just moving the print head and carriage more slowly?

The HP 8600 had minor, less noticeable banding, but also had some weird squiggly thing going on so that the images had faint jagged lines through them that reminded me of a TV picture scrambled by a ham or CB radio.
The Epson has the smoothest and most uniform print.
The Epson had the best picture for uniformity by far.
The Epson also has cheap price per page.

You would hear it make some noise, thinking maybe it was about to start, but it would grind on and on and on, and I was convinced it was pumping massive quantities of ink into the waste ink reservoir.
The 922 uses the same ink cartridges so must share some parts in common, yet it started printing right away.
But after printing, it's grinding away too, probably wasting ink.
Overall, I wanted to get the Epson and tolerate the dull colors because of the amazing uniformity in standard mode, and the cheap prints.
And I liked the HP for the sturdiness and excellent control panel.
She liked the Canon prints the best because of the color, contrast and sharpness, and preferred the 922 because the 5420 was so slow.
In high quality mode, its plain paper prints are the best.

Both the 5420 and 922 are subjectively rattlely and not rugged compared to the Epson and HP, plus they both have flimsy and awkward control buttons compared to the Epson and HP controls, which are touch screen units.
Wifi setup was really easy, it gave me a list of access points, I picked my router and entered in the WPA2 key using the buttons.
The MX922 belongs at a sub-$120 price point in my book.
But we'd have grudgingly paid $150 for it over the other two brands which were in the $130 range, and the super-cheap but excruciatingly slow $50 MG5420.
Canon printer - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Like the printer, prints great 4x6 photos and like the easy wireless setup.
Uses a lot of ink but I try to keep spare ink around.
And now the wireless function gives an error 6901.
I must say I LOVE the fact that I can print from my phone, ipad, flash drive, you name it!

Good printer, software issues - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) As is typical with Canon, print quality is good, but software support is lacking.
Installing all OC the canon utilities is kind of annoying, as it comes with way too many software features.
Alas, there is no scan software for Win 7 document scanning.

Pros No setup for iPad & iPhone AirPrint compatible Windows XP support for quick scan utility Scan to USB, fast & high quality Duplex printing Wifi (WPS one touch setup works great) Great packaging, easy lift handles to remove from box Large paper tray Cons 1-2 minutes to start printing first page after coming out of standby No scan utility for Win 7 PCs, need to download your own scanning software!!!

iPad/iPhone printing often selects manual feed tray, requires reset to fix Ink is used VERY quickly Wifi printing large files up to 5min /page No wifi status, always shows blue even if its not working Scanner jams easily Overall, a good printer.
I decided against another HP printer and bought this printer.
Installation was flawless on my desktop (XP) and my (win 7) laptop.
Wireless and Fax installed easily.
It is pretty loud but has a sound adjustment.
I wonder why they didn't just make it sound lower in the first place.
I was impressed that the software installed on both XP and Win 7.
I printed out a few photos and they were nice.
Once the software is installed there is a basic menu and I printed a couple of pages, like how the fax paper goes in and the regular paper and photo loads.
Easy setup, very good scanning and excellent pictures - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) The title says it all.
Printing okay.
Slow to Start up and Noisy - Canon Office Products MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I haven't had this very long.
It was a little tricky to set up because the directions weren't very clear in setting up the wireless mode.
When turning it on it makes all sorts of clicks, turning sounds, unlike my previous Canon Pixma.
I don't know if it's supposed to do that but it's pretty noisy and takes about 10 minutes to be ready to print.
When sending to print it seems slow to spool in wifi mode, but printing is pretty fast.
In standard mode print quality seems pretty clean so far.
My main concern is all the noise in the beginning.
Set up is very easy.
Love the fact that it's wireless.
Good for the price, it's big though - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Fast scanning.
Loud and big, but I don't care, it's faster than what I had before (hp deskjet 5100)
Many functions, a bit noisy - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) This sits next to my computer.

Uses lots of ink - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) This highly rated as ink efficient but it used the original inks in about a month and I don't think we have printed more than 150 pages so I will contact canon what is wrong?
If I knew the Epson would have been a better buy !!
But I does perform well but a little more complicated than Epson but quiet mode and double sided printing is nice
Doesn't work With Mac - Canon Office Products MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) My mac rejected the "Set Up CD-rom".
For $99.99 they could install one for me.
DON'T BUY IF YOU HAVE A MAC.

Wireless won't work - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I'm sure this is a good printer, it works fine with USB, however I bought it based on wireless capability and I have now spent a total of 32 hours trying to get it to work and it still cannot be found by any of my devices.
Good Printer But Ripped Off on Ink Cartridges - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Much better than Epson printers.
But I was ripped off on my purchase of cartridges for it.
Nothing but problems. - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Could not get this setup correctly.
It runs out of ink in no time at all.
The ink replacements are too expensive.
What I do not like is the cost of the canon ink.
Second Canon worked great, nice quality pictures, good software, copier works great, and scanner.
Disappointing for wireless networked printing - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Well, so far this printer has been very disappointing.
Although set up was fairly easy on my wireless network and it worked well the first time, the next time I went to use it, I got a Printer Not Connected to Network message.
After reading some other 2 star reviews, I found some info on the problem - seems the printer disconnects from the network when it goes into sleep mode.
Another drawback to this printer is that the print quality of text is not impressive.
My ancient HP 1610 had better quality print.
If you plan to do wireless printing, chose another printer.
Unfortunately, the replacement printer is also defective and can not be set up.

Nice Printer - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) It was fairly easy to set up, I had a bit of a problem getting it to recognize my network, but once I figured that out, it works great.
But I love the wireless.
- Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) It is noisy and takes alot of time to warm up, but I love it!
It is so much better than my old Epson in every way.

ADF does not work - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) The automatic document feeder (ADF) does not work, and I am not crazy about the menu, and not the easiest to operate.
Spent the last 1.5hrs trying to set it up and it will not print.
Sounds like it's printing but paper is blank.
So convenient being able to print from my iPad Mini or iPhone!
Resolution is beautiful as well.

Great usage , Loud and slow startup. - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I was looking for alternative printer to give me room for paper storage and so far I am loving this printer but only drawback is its very loud and it takes time to load up.
Nice printer for the price. - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) So far this has been an excellent printer for the money.
It has so many features not found on other printers in this price range.
It is much quieter than my previous printer with better print quality and speed.
I set it all up according to the instructions that arrived with it.
I memorized my home network's passcode and eventually got it to connect with the router.
"The printer is offline."
My husband & I were looking forward to the wireless printing, which I had never set up on our MX700.
A little trying to setup wireless.
Initially it would not recognize the wireless device and no WPS button to push, what????
Turned it off, unplugged it, disabled the Wi-Fi, restored my computer to earlier date and then set it up using the cable and it printed the test page and picture with no problem.
It is noisy (even on the quiet mode) and takes forever to do anything, so I am leaving it on all the time.
Setup took FOREVER.
The paper trays are difficult to access.
But the kicker for me - the piece that keeps the papers on the output tray and keeps them from falling on the floor broke.

needed a new printer to replace my HP g85 - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) It is ok...the scanner is great, but it constantly requires restarting and configuration of the wireless.
It does well when it is attached, I can print from nay of my computers, ipad, etc.
Don't buy any Canon PIXMA if you expect to use wireless - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I bought a MX922 about 6 weeks ago.
I have tried everything to get the printer to respond to wi-fi and print from my Apple iPhones and iPad and my 2 Windows 7 PCs.
The printer drops the connection to wi-fi or won't wake up after a period of time.
If I get it to work with Apple it won't work with PC or vice versa.
Canon has user forums for its products and if you go to the Wireless/Networking forum for their printers there are pages of complaints and questions from users of about every model.
Terrible Printer - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) This is by far the noisiest and slowest printer I've ever used.
It went through ink like crazy and of course the OEM cartridges are expensive as with most printers.
Do yourself a favor and avoid this printer, don't let the lower price sway your decision.

Good quality output but drops wireless a LOT. - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I got this as a replacement for an 880 which was taking longer and longer to prepare itself for each print job (minutes, sometimes).
It also did not have the ability to print from an iphone or ipad without a $50 add-on.
For $50, I figured it was time to upgrade to a newer version.

I've had this printer a couple of months now and the print quality and speed is good, but only after I have to reconfigure the wireless nearly every time...and in my setup it sits alongside the router, which means it's not hard to reset, but a hassle when trying to print and finding out there is no printer on the network.
Quality for color photo printing is decent enough.

If your output "flap" is open (becomes output tray for copies at the front center of the unit) when you reach to raise the lid of the unit to access the copy bed, you will instead grab the access panel for the interior of the copier.
If the output tray is closed, that is covered and its a non-issue, but if you are making copies or scanning via the flat bed it is *very* frustrating and I've been tempted to tape it shut.
The bigger issue is the frequent dropping of the wireless signal, which is far worse than my old 880.
Inks are expensive, but they all are.

I've been a loyal Canon multifunction printer customer for many years, through at least 5 different models, but given the dropping wireless issue I would not recommend this unless you are planning to use it as a wired printer or don't mind resetting the wireless every day.
And the trays are very flimsy.
I don't need the printer telling me and trying to set up where I should save my projects.
Very 'smart phone' and 'windows 8' platform styled.
Photo printing is as good as it gets, but with a bit less accuracy (blues and greens) compared to my previous MP640 photo printer.
They verified cleaning uses ink from all cartridges and instructed me not to switch off the printer, even when I will not use it for days, since the printer will clean every time it is switched on.
This is on a Wifi connection but I suspect it would be the same over USB since the time appears to be taken up by the printer cleaning nozzles, etc.
It doesn't seem to be possible to scan over the Wifi connection.
To run the setup program need a functioning printer.
Resit urge to throw printer out window.
Couldn't ask for anything more hope ink is cheap
Easy to Use - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) The setup for this printer was for me --easy, and I am not necessary technically savvy.
I just set it up yesterday so I don't know all of the ins and outs yet...but so far--so good.
Wireless set-up was easy but I did have to go to the Canon software page for an update, but other than that--no issues.
I had nothing but problems communicating with Windows 8.
Worked with Mac but not windows.
I guess I will be returning to HP.
- Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) The only thing that keeps (well two things) from 5 stars are it's size and ink consumption.
Like all Canon printers it drinks a lot of ink in just keeping the print head clean.
Have not set up the wireless feature yet but I think it would be very useful if you put it somewhere other than on your desk .

Prints Great - Disfunctional Wireless - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Overall this prints nice but the wireless works on an unpredictable, intermittent basis.
But about half the time, the printer drops wireless print tasks from the laptop downstairs even though we are only 30 feet away at the most.
In particular, scanning is much harder to do than on my old HP printer because there is no indication of where to find the scanned file or how to print it.
Also, I was a little shocked to find that one set of extra large print cartridges costs more than the printer, even after a $15 discount at Staples.
I wish somebody would come up with a way to break through the PC printing "racket".
Printer - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Prints very well, a little loud and uses a lot ink.
Buying ink is expensive unless you can find them on sale.
Awesome - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Great printer at a great price.
Bought a HP at Walmart and returned it the following week.
nice for the price, but way bigger than I imagined - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) The printer take sup more than half of my desk!
The set up was easy and the printer pretty much thinks on its own.
Wireless setup was good and the fact that i can print from iphone/ipad is very good.
Scanning document through ADF is very sensitive to any buckle in paper (did not have that issue with mx700 to scan my expense reports with receipts taped on paper).
Overall feels like this printer is lot more noisy.
We have noticed it prints extremely slow while printing wirelessly as well as we've noticed it will sometimes smudge the ink when printing wirelessly.
For the price I would recommend it to anyone that isn't looking to print a lot.
Noisy - but cheap - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) The printer is over the top sophisticated for me.
It makes a LOT of funny noises at odd times.
SUCKS ink!
But for the price I will consider it a throw away
Also, the wi-fi option never works, even after you follow all the manual procedures.
OK but not impressed - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I bought this printer after using HP printers for years for my home office.
This printer produces good quality copies but I haven't tried photo printing yet.
Compared to my last HP printer, this printer is not as user friendly as it does not have a touch screen, which is a significant drawback.
Also I burned through the black ink cartridge in less than a month of moderate use.
I think the HP black cartridges lasted a lot longer.

NOISY & SLOW - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) First, I did not purchase from Amazon, because I found another source on eBay, with free shipping, no sales tax and matched Amazon's price.
I gave this printer only three stars because of the issues during set-up and the so-called customer support.
Here is the 411: My experience with the set up was a chore.
To be specific: Out of the box the set up was pretty easy until I attempted to set up the wireless connection- what a nightmare!
After they started going through all my files and then found many that were supposedly 'infected' which was why I could not set up the wireless connection.
The answer was to turn me over to a 'Microsoft rep' who offered various packages from $150 to $500 to clean up all this malware, Trojan horses etc.
After sleeping on the issue for a night, I made another attempt using my laptop (which is the primary reason I purchased a wireless printer).

Well, to make a very long story much shorter I went through the wireless set-up process again; this time using the 'other' option because the printer couldn't locate the WPS button (probably because this router does not have such a button-DUH!).
I printed a document, and although somewhat slow and noisy, out came a pristine page.
My wife was sitting across our desk with her IPad, and had similar success.
I have not figured out how to print envelopes, or set up the fax, or any of the other functions but will update soon when I do.
So far so good - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) It prints very well, and the online capabilities are pretty impressive.
It was easy to install on our Airport wifi and works nicely with our Macs .
And it's a lot noisier, which I can live with easily if it weren't for how much churning and thinking and whirring it does before printing most documents.
Haven't tried faxing yet, but I went through setup and heard the dial tone, so I assume that will be simple enough.

photo print quality - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Photo print quality is not good that I expected and too big size,noisy Basic printing quality is fine :) !

Google Cloud Print is awesome and simple to set up, all my cloud printing dreams have been realized; unfortunately 'copy' and 'scan' functions are kept entirely distinct from the useful flexibility of cloud printing.
Wifi setup still painful - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) It's hard to understand how the setup of a wifi device can still be so hard.
I have tons of devices connected to my router and the setup is always easy, except when it comes to canon printers.
Picked this up to see if it would dethrone the champ - Epson WorkForce WF-3520 Wireless All-in-One Color Inkjet Printer, Copier, Scanner, 2-Sided Duplex, ADF, Fax.
Prints from Tablet/Smartphone.
It's certainly superior to any consumer or mid business grade HP - and doesn't have the ridiculous bloatware and requirements for calibration, etc. that the Epson has.
I'd sacrifice the quality for the better price. - Super easy setup.
It found my Wifi quickly, using the integrated screen.
No messing with wires or one-time setup.

Same with the iPad - found it quickly and could print from there without an issue. - It prints quality documents of every type, both in color and black and white. - Compared to the Epson, the interface is much easier to use and more modern.
The Epson has this and it's very nice for envelopes, one-offs, etc. - The software isn't nearly as user friendly as the Epson software.
From scanning to printing, I prefer the Epson, mostly due to the fuller feature set of the scanning software.
The Epson only has one tray but it is very large, and it has a rear feed.
Overall, this is an excellent printer but not up to the level of the Epson, UNLESS you need to print photos.

Not great, but good enough - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Yes, it's big and noisy.

Sheet fed and flat bed scanning.
Apple Airprint support.

NOT an easy set up. - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) First off, let me say I hope to come back tomorrow and update both my stars and my rating, but for right now, I am tired and frustrated.

Unable to connect to my home network.

I hope we don't have to haul the printer into the other room just to connect to our wireless network!!

and the prints are good.

- Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) After years of HP printers that always had paper jams and crooked print, I purchased an Epson which was even worse.

Does not feed Photo Paper - Canon Office Products MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Printer works fine with paper, it's slick, networks easy, probably is a great printer for regular paper.

Good printer at a decent price. - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I have used this printer for over a month.
I prefer printers like the MX922 that have 5 ink cartridges, and use less expensive ink from Amazon sellers LD and Sophia Global.
The price of $156 plus tax, including a double ink supply, was reasonable.
Installation was straight forward.
I installed the MX922 wirelessly, and it works without problems with my Windows desktop, 2 Windows netbooks and an Apple iPad.
My earlier trials of wireless installation with the MX870 failed, so I am happy with the MX922 as a wireless printer.
My negative comments are size and noise.
The MX922 is noisy, noisier than the MX870, which was not a quiet printer.
Bottom line - a good printer at a decent price, including ink for at least a year.
For the past five years I was using a pretty good HP model.
Right out of the box it connected to my WIFI without a problem.
The print quality, both documents and photos, is superior.
And it's quiet.
Loading the paper tray is effortless.
This is an excellent printer at a very low price.
- Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I went from a Kodak 2710 to this...and let me tell ya..This is a great printer.
Wireless printing works flawlessly, although there are a couple of hiccups with that.

First, I cannot connect the printer with the easy "press the WPS button" setup on the router/cable modem from Comcast, I have to actually enter the network key - which is no big deal, but it would have been nice to be able to do that.

Second, I've noticed that the printer doesn't print when it's in sleep mode - that is if I send a print job to it while it's in sleep mode nothing comes out and I get the notification on my computer that the printer is not connected.

Only other issue is that if we haven't used it to print for a few days it will take a VERY long time to print the first page (my guess is that it knows it wasn't being used and is cleaning out the printer head before it prints, whereas the Kodak used to just immediately print a horrible copy - I actually had to print two or three copies of something to get anything useful with the Kodak - so I don't mind this at all - I would rather it take a little bit of time to print something good the first time instead of having to print multiple copies to get something useful).
The print quality is second to none, AND the photo quality is FANTASTIC (really, it looks like you just picked up the picture from the Fotomat)!

Love my old MX860 - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) So much that I got this for my girlfriend and it is every bit as awesome as the 860...yes it is slow on the print...but it does so much, from duplex scanning to PDF to awesome photo printing...hey kick your feet up and relax...it does it all wirelessly and set up is a breeze..sure it is big but so is my work copier and it is WAY bigger (yes way faster) but this does all that and with cheap replacement cartridges on Amazon.
but just makes this annoying noise as if its checking every single component of the printer.
Excellent print quality, but a few issues - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Customer review from the Amazon Vine™ Program (What's this?)
Note: I do not use the fax function, so I didn't set it up, but I do use wireless.
Setup: Was easy and went smoothly.
I had to have my son in law make a couple choices with the Wireless set up.

Features: Regarding the scan function, I like to use the grayscale mode at times, and I found I did have to install the CD drivers, which prompted me to download an update (to update the Windows 7 driver that worked fine otherwise), to get the grayscale mode to show up.
Print quality: Is very high.
Two Issues: (1) As other reviewers have pointed out, it is noisy, especially on startup and at times when feeding paper, clunky sounding.
So far, none have woken up due to the printer sounds.
(2) The paper feeder is not flawless.
Consequently when the printer fed the paper in for printing, it took two sheets, instead of only the photo paper sheet, and printed mainly on the regular printer paper, not the photo paper.
So, basically, a good printer that produces high quality prints.
Canon MX922 - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I had 3 printers, a HP, Epson and a Kodak.
Some would work with one computer and another with a different computer but none with all..
The Canon works with a iMac, iPad 1, iPad 2, Windows 7 desktop, Windows 8 desktop, and Samsung Galaxy 3 cell phone.
The print quality is very good and speed is also.
I had a few problems getting everything on my network working.
Very pleased with the MX922 and got a great price on Amazon.
The new MX 922 is a bit quicker and the quality of the scans and printing remains excellent.
So far, the automatic document feed (ADF) works well with good (not perfect) alignment.
The only significant con I would mention is the noise.
The old printer made plenty of whirring and clunking as it booted up and before/during ADF feed operations, but this one sounds more like a combination cement mixer and gravel truck.
I definitely suggest that you consider this printer if you are looking for a good quality multi-function printer with automatic document feed.
working good so far - Canon Office Products MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I would have given 5 star but due to paper small paper tray I gave 4.

In the past I've had HP, but haven't had great experiences with their printers lately (the last one I had starting failing one month after the 1 year warranty expired.

It was very easy to install.
The install takes about 14 minutes, but the install program warns you of this.

I find this is the easiest way to print pictures from my phone (even my 6 year old can do it) so this is a plus.

This was the first thing to go on my last printer, so working wi-fi makes me happy.
We'll see how long it lasts, but I haven't heard of major issues with the Canons so I'm not worried.
I set it up to connect to Google Cloud Print.
So now I can easily print from my samsung tablet.

So far I've set up multiple computers, printed wirelessly, printed via cloud, printed via bluetooth, printed pictures and set up my fax preferences.
I haven't scanned or faxed yet, but all the printing has been good quality.
It's a bit quieter than my HPs which is nice.
In the meantime, I definitely recommend the printer for ease of setup and solid performance.

Canon MX922 - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) This machine is very noisy.

Amazing printer - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Saw this on a gold box deal for $80 and couldn't resist getting this as an upgrade to my old MX-320.
Easy setup, flawless printing from a Windows 7 desktop, a Windows 8 laptop, an Iphone 5 and an Ipad, all wireless.
It's much quieter, Photo quality is wonderful and ink usage seems minimal (despite printing lots of photos the "starter" ink packs still show about 1/2 full).

Canon, Epson and HP (and smaller other players) fight hard to outdo each other so consumers will buy their products - and become enslaved to the expensive ink cartridges.
Print quality is excellent.
Photos printed on a good glossy paper have lots of vibrance and look good.
All text documents are good, though not as sharp as laser printed documents.
One try is used for photo papers, which is really nice if you print a lot of photos.
By way of example, my workhorse HP MFC has two trays.
I noticed that a number of people complain of difficulties using WiFi with this unit.
My installation went smoothly.
I strongly urge reading the installation guide if you intend to use WiFi.
Beyond that, as long as you adhere to the directions, set-up is straight-forward and without surprises.
The MX922 does a good job of printing office documents and photographs.
The MX922 is not an ink hog, though cartridges are still more costly than I would like.
Overall, I think the design of this unit is slanted more toward the home user, with its emphasis on photo printing and inconvenient paper handling.
After completing the tedious business of aligning the ink heads, my next problem was getting the thing hooked up to the Internet.
I've installed several computers and connected them to WiFi with little effort.
I needed a magnifying glass so I wouldn't press the other pin-sized button next to it by mistake, which could possibly have destroyed our entire WiFi system.
Installing the disc so that the printer would work with a laptop took a very, VERY long time.
When it finally finished installing and started running a registration feature, I was so annoyed that I just hit a box that said "Yes" and, strangely enough, it complied.
other than that is was easy to setup for wireless printing and the canon app works fine with it.
Easy to set up - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I have used Canon printers for a while and this generation is an improvement.
Quiet, quick, and feature laden.
- Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Absolutely love the ease of printing from anywhere in the home!
Beautiful photos too and all at an exceptional price.
The 850 had a rear paper feed, compared to the 922 which only feeds from bottom paper trays.
With the rear feed on the 850 you just put your special form or paper on the top of the paper stack in the rear feed and voila!
The other problem I've experienced is that the 922 frequently pulls multiple sheets from the paper tray.
When you fill it up it can't seem to pull the sheets off the top well enough.
Setting it up was a snap, and the print quality is good.
It is easy to set up and it is a great buy.
Somewhere between HP and Epson - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Customer review from the Amazon Vine™ Program (What's this?)
I wound up with three 4-in-1 machines: an HP Office Jet Pro, an Epson Small-in-One, and this Canon.
It has a larger footprint than the Epson but smaller than the HP.
If your space is limited, go with the Epson.
Epson and HP will leave you hanging while you race to get new ink tanks.
I feel that the Epson has better color quality (but more ink tanks to account for this) but the Canon is good enough for non-photographer types like me.
I was concerned when everything in the box stated that it's intended for Windows OS 8 or higher (or Mac), since I have Windows 7.
As with HP and Epson, the ink tanks are disgustingly expensive.
I think the price for the PIXMA is reasonable.
Personally, my favorite thing about this is the fact that it won't stop dead in the middle of a print job if one ink tank goes dry.
Otherwise, I prefer the HP for b&w printing (though it is very large and awkward) and the Epson for photo printing (though it has 6 tiny ink tanks).
Set-up was okay, though the manuals are online and in tiny print, as noted above.
Takes forever to start printing and is very noisy - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I replaced my Pixma 870 which died.

Great printer - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) The printer worked right out of the box with almost no setup.

Making all kinds of noise and ruckus.

Really like the print quality - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) The print quality of this Canon Pixma is excellent.
Also, having to fold up the paper receiving tray in order to get to the paper loading tray is somewhat of a pain since I print a lot of two sided items.
All in all, I would buy it again and it certainly beats any HP I've had...and I've had a lot of them!

- Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Faxing, copying, scanning, printing, this unit does it all, the wireless printing from my iPad,I am really impressed!

produces good photo quality prints, but as always for canon, longevity is the key issue... - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Amazon usually has great deals on Canon printers, and the MX922 is probably the fourth photo quality Canon printer I have bought at Amazon in the last few years.
While the ink never lasts as long as I would like, the MX922 usually produces colors that are accurate, and the prints have a decent amount of detail.

For $90 as a Deal of the Day, the MX922 was a good buy, but I hope that this printer is more durable than my previous Pixma printers, which although lightly used, mysteriously died for no apparent reason after lasting just over a year.
It seems that every time I get a new printer, Canon has developed a new type of ink cartridge, so I can't use my old supply of ink.

The cost of genuine Canon ink cartridges is exorbitant, so it's cool that there are some non-OEM cartridges available, but the bad thing is the substitutes for the MX922 cost a lot more than the previous generation of generics I used to buy.
These items sometimes go on sale cheap at Amazon, so if you put them on your watch list, you might be able to score a good deal.
The unit sometimes makes a lot of noise, when starting up or shutting down, and it can take a while to warm up.
The MX922 does a decent job of scanning and copying, and is a fairly good value as an "all around" printer.
Excellent printing - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) The only problem is that the instruction book is badly organized.
to a MX922 and this thing is so noisy as it goes through its convulsions...?

The printer is noisier than the other one and takes quite a bit longer to warm up (both at turning it on and sending something to it to print), and the pages are printer slower than my old one (even though it said it was faster ppm).

Haven't set it up for FAX since it seems to want a 'dedicated' line to the phone and we use this at home with a home phone...that will have to be a 'trade off' - home off for fax, fax off for home....
But it prints pretty well, colors are nice.
Slow Noisy Printer with Bad Wireless Capability - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) This printer was awful.
Set up was smooth and everything was good for the first few printouts on the first day -- from both an iPad 3 and from a Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1.

But a few days later, when I tried to print from the iPad, it wouldn't work.
I kept getting some looping error message about needing to load the paper tray.
I gave up and tried printing from the by-pass or whatever other tray was available (I can't remember now), but then I started getting wireless network errors.
I couldn't send print jobs from my Apple or Droid device.
I tried going through set up all over again for the network, but the printer's wireless capability just seemed to quit working altogether.
Got it primarily of the Wi Fi printing.
Only problem(and it's a problem with all inkjets) is it uses ink fast and the refills are so darn expensive!

Easy to set up, easy to use ... - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Customer review from the Amazon Vine™ Program (What's this?)
My last all-in-one printer, a VERY old non-wireless HP (a Photosmart C3180), lasted for 8 years before it started to have "issues."
Set up was a breeze with my MacBook Pro, much easier than I thought it would be.
Things I like: this baby has a document feeder.
Print quality is outstanding for both photos and documents.
Print speed is good -- faster than my old HP.
Scanning is also faster than my HP, but still slower than I'd like.
Copying is faster than my old HP, too.
I LOVE the wireless capability and AirPrint -- another first for me.
That was relatively easy to set up, too.
It's also a bit noisy, but I have it sitting in a separate room where I can close the door, so it's not too bad.
But just bear in mind that it's a bit noisy.
The print quality is outstanding, and it seems a solid well-built machine.
It's too early to assess its durability, and I haven't printed enough to gauge the ink usage (I've printed maybe 50 pages so far, including about 40 B/W and 10 color).

Some flaws but still a very good all-in-one - Canon Office Products MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) The Canon MX922 can both print and scan wirelessly, a big plus for me.
And the wireless setup is very, very easy.
In addition to fast wireless printing from my PC, it also prints wirelessly from my iPad Mini.
Unlike the MX860, which allowed you load both legal size paper AND envelopes easily into the rear tray and letter size paper into the lower/bottom tray, the MX922 only has two lower trays.

Thus, if you have to print a legal size document, a letter size cover letter, and an envelope, you will have to first put letter sized paper in the bottom tray, print out your cover letter, pull out the tray, take out the stack of letter size paper in the tray, make the aforementioned bizarre adjustment to the tray, insert legal size paper into the tray, print out your legal sized document, take the bottom tray out again, reverse the adjustment for legal size paper, adjust the tray for envelopes, print out the envelope, pull out the bottom tray yet again, adjust the tray for letter size paper, insert letter size paper, and finally once again insert the bottom tray back into the machine.
Installation and connection to my network was very easy.
I'm disappointed in the printing from smartphone function.
After setup you need to send an attached file to an email address that winds up printing.
Time to go back to HP.
A nice "Disposable" printer - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I'd recommend the PIXMA MX452 at half the price.

Exceptional Printer for the Price!

Only a full tray would permit papers to be fed for printing.
The positives far out number the negatives and are more meaningful. ?It is wireless and that is a game winner for me.
I can sit in the TV room and use a netbook, laptop or tablet and when I need to print something it is simple Control P and in a few seconds I can get my output from the other side of the house.
Additionally, the setup was easy for not only the wireless applications but the entire process.

While I often need a memory boaster to remember which side should go up or down when performing these jobs I prepared a simple sticker that reminds me "original up" to assist. ?The quality of the output is typical Canon: fantastic.
I really like the photo quality and it is especially great if the proper glossy paper is used. ?This printer has two paper trays that Canon calls cassettes.
The smaller tray is for smaller sized prints and, I really liked this one, a place for making a label for computer discs such as a CD or DVD label.
Now I can print a quality, readable label which is far better than my scribbling with a marking pen.
The larger tray handles 8.5X11 and 8.5Z14 legal papers as well as the old standard U.S. government size.
There is a single post to hold the paper before it released for the printer to print instead of having two posts such as the smaller tray has.
This MX922 has the attention to details that one would expect from a quality camera maker and every element is reflected in a top notch machine for a reasonable price.

Good print quality, great price - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I bought this to replace an HP wireless printer which I thought was crapping out.
The printer would work wirelessly for a while but would then drop off the network until I reinstalled it on each computer.
Since it had no Ethernet port and I had nowhere to set it up as a USB printer I was forced to replace it.
When I set up the Canon printer I found I had the same problem with it, it wouldn't print over the wireless connection.
I did a lot of troubleshooting and am now convinced that it is a problem with my router.
I had read the reviews of others saying they couldn't print over a wireless connection and I wonder if the problem is not with the printer but with their wireless router.
I have a Cisco Linksys E3000 router so if you have the same or similar router be warned you may not be able to print wirelessly with any printer without some amount of fiddling.
The printer shows up in the DHCP server list but Windows 7 for some reason won't see it when it is connected wirelessly.
I set up a static IP address for the printer hoping this would fix it but to no avail.

I kept the static IP address when I plugged in with an Ethernet cable and Windows saw the printer with no problem then I was forced to set this up as a wired network printer because I couldn't fix the problem with the router.
After printing a few documents and photos I can say it has very good print quality.
I have seen better but only on much more expensive printers, it definitely blows away the HP I am replacing.
It was easy to set up, though a bit time consuming.
The instructions that were included were easy to follow and connecting wirelessly was very simple, though it didn't work in my case.

I haven't had this long enough to comment on how long the ink cartridges last but they seem to be lasting longer than the cartridges in my old HP (I had to replace the cartridges in that every couple of months no matter how much or how little I printed).
I won't knock down the rating because of the wireless issue because as stated I am completely sure it is an issue with my router.
This has been simple to set up and use, has terrific wireless range, and let's me print straight from my iPhone, iPad and laptops.
Best yet, it isn't an HP (count yourself lucky if you've never had to endure the lousy service after your inferior product failed).
This is a great printer for the price, and would have been worth it for even more.

I spent about 10 minutes finding the user manuals on the canon site and downloading them to my laptop.

But nothing in these forums solved my problem - my printer really was offline as far as wireless and cloud printing was concerned.
I finally deleted the printer from Google's cloud registration service page and reran the setup and re-registered the printer and it began working again.

I haven't faxed anything from this printer and probably won't so I don't know how that service works.

For $99 I really cannot complain but if you are going to purchase this printer be aware of the items I mentioned above.
An excellent multi-function - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) A bit large and noisy but produces excellent copies and documents.

Had to call and talk to a rep to get it connected to my wireless LAN.
My HP was constantly dropping from my wireless network -- the Canon is worse!!
Reminds me of the great Apple phone support!
The two Canon phone reps that turned it around for me were Chris who walked me thru connecting to my wireless network and Dave who walked me thru scanning and duplex copying.

Then, somewhere on the Internet I found these instructions which have kept my Canon from dropping off my local wireless network: (1)Go to Menu>>Setup>>Device Settings>>Lan Settings>>Other Settings>>TCP/IP Settings>>IPv6 Choose No 2)Go to Menu>>Setup>>Device Settings>>Lan Settings>>Other Settings>>Wireless LAN DRX Setting Choose Disable.

Working Just As It Should - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I had another printer which was costing me an "arm & leg" for the ink.
I did a lot of research and found this printer where even the Canon ink cost was far less than the competition and I could also use after market ink in the printer.
I have used after market ink in many printers and seldom have an issue.
The set up was fairly easy however time consuming and this took the better part of an hour.
While a DVD comes with the printer, once you insert the DVD into your MAC there is a lengthy download which take place and then the software mist be installed.
Unpacking the unit, with all the tape, etc on the printer will take a few minutes and I strongly suggest you read the instructions, even if you have installed a dozen printers before.
The quality of my prints thus far have been very good.
Could have used the wireless but seem like that always take me far more time on the is installation.
All attempts to make the connection a Wireless connection would fail in time and require a reboot of the printer.

The printer was purchased to add Apple AirPrint to the system, and a lot of time and money was wasted with Apple and others before I found every one had the same problem and the answer was to wire the printer into the network.
I wanted a product with a trustworthy name, multi-function, AirPrint, and Mac compatible.
This also includes printing from my iPad or iPhone.
None of my laptops (Windows and Mac), or mobile devices can find the printer on my wireless network.
I've had it less than 4 months and I already have to replace ink on a printer that barely ever works.

SENT BACK - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Couldn t get wireless to work at all tried many times so returned item printer was ok little bit large but was ok
After setting it up (prints Test pages like a pro), I had my wife try it out to print out some of her work documents.
I promptly threw this in the trash, where it belongs, and put the $40 HP printer back in and everything works fine.
It seems to loose connectivity when it sits idle for an extended period of time.
Drops wifi.
Here's what you can look forward to... -GONE ability to scan from ADF or PLATEN and accumulate pages on screen to save as single PDF.

Now you must scan each type, save it, then assemble it into a single PDF yourself. -GONE fast scanning from the ADF in most modes (it pulls paper in about 4" then pauses for about 13 seconds before slowly finishing each page!) -GONE ability to quickly select from a single menu the source you ant to scan and then the document type (magazine, B&W document, color document, etc.). What used to take a few clicks on one menu now takes about 8 on multiple, confusing sub menus. -GONE ability to scan multiple pages then crop one or to before saving into a PDF (or printing).
Then there is the issue of the dropping off the wifi network randomly.
It does print beautifully.

Dead after a year & a half of light use - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Can't complain about the set-up since my technologically challenged husband was able to do it.
We printed out some photos that were absolutely beautiful, but I have been unable to figure out how to print out 4 x 6" photos - the most popular size!
Tech support is available only Mon - Fri, making it very difficult for working folks to access.
It would make all its usual preliminary grinding & knocking sounds with the printer head whirring busily back & forth, then spit out a sheet of paper, pristine white & blank.
It's very noisy & busy.
And this was right after it insisted it needed new ink.
This thing was a very thirsty beast, & replacement cartridges, though they look big, apparently contain an entire drop of ink & are expensive!
So basically after a little more than a year - the last several months limping along - this noisy, thirsty beast has died.
Canon can produce "new & improved" printers in a constant stream but you have no idea what you're actually going to get for your money.
I'm going back to HP - our last HP lasted about 5 years, ink cartridges were easy to replace & less expensive & last much longer.
It was easy to operate & produced nice prints & photos.
Fine printer - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Yes as someone pointed out, it can be a bit noisy, but what a nice printer.
My previous printer was a Epson Workforce 1100; nice printer, never failed, but this one does more and takes less space.
Printing large format with the Epson was nice but not really necessary for my day to day requirements.
I mainly wanted a high quality photo printer and chose this model because I am familiar with some older Canon photo printers that were wonderful photo printers.

Main disappointments: -could not find a printer with both card reader and USB -rather slow photo printing especially from USB -can NOT crop photo images to print as with earlier models -you must reset paper type:matte, glossy, glossy II, etc. or you are wasting both paper & ink as the quality is horrible!
very reasonable price.
Ink consumption seems to be a little high, otherwise an excellent purchase for general home and office use.
Unable to print wirelessly (printer issue) and overly complicated menus - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I do not recommend this printer.
It did not work well as a wireless printer with my Mac.

Great Printer - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Great printer bought it during the lighting deals could not pass it up and was definitely worth it if there any thing that could be changed would be the size its a bit bulky but nonetheless it does what it supposed to do.
print awesome the wireless capability is great easy set up by far the easiest printer set up i have ever done.
Large, Plastic, Noisy - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) This printer is awkward, slow, and noisy.
For some reason the wireless connection stopped working in that one, but now I might see what I can do to revive it a little harder.
I purchased this product in part because of the ADF feature.
Well, less than 24 hours out of the box and ADF jams when trying to print or scan.
However, the cost of replacing those print cartridges is cheaper than old models so I'm happy with that.
Also, I'm enjoying the ability to wirelessly print documents from my smartphones.
I pride myself on owning my printers (HP & Canon) for many years before they finally crap out, and I'm satisfied I got my money's worth and then some.
I could live with the noise it produces, that it's pretty big for a printer, and that's it's really slow, but this printer eats paper and ink like it's going out of style.
If ONE of the ink cartridges is dry, then it will not print anything until it's replaced, so you better have replacement cartridges on hand at all times.
Even if you're printing only a B&W, and a color cartridge is empty, it will hold you hostage for your print job until the color cartridge is replaced.

Good Printer but needs a larger - 251 Black ink Cartridge - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Bought this Printer - works great - the only reason I wouldn't give it a 4-5 star is due to the ink usage- the 251 blk cartridge is small - I really don't print a huge amount.
Only complaint, and nothing new, it goes through ink pretty quickly and, of course, the ink cartridge replacements are steep.

Acceptable print quality but fax is utterly useless - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Perhaps what I have experienced with this machine is reflective of the vagaries associated with multi-function devices.
The print quality is acceptable if one never wishes to print images larger than 8.5 X 11.good but far from great, but that is to be expected with machines of this genre.
Sadly, this one is going into the trash and I will replace it with an Epson.

Best printer we've owned - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Auto-duplex, works with my iPad native printing feature, and, AND, the best part: It's been telling us the ink is low for at least two months, but it keeps on printing.
OH, and it opens the paper door automatically, so you don't have to go to some other room of the house to do it.
* the bad: thinks and process for a long time before printing (wireless print).
The wireless set up was very simply.

Canon should have made this better - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) This printer was disappointing, it is noisy and takes way to long to ramp up.
The wifi is a joke, it can't seem to make up its mind what to do.
Printing adequate.
It is a bit slow to get ready to print and I haven't had to replace any ink yet.
The wireless connectivity has been flawless and the scanning functionality (scan to PC) actually works hassle free unlike my last HP multifunction.
Also, unlike my HP printers from the past, aftermarket ink has worked EVERY time without warning me about my horrible sin of using non-OEM ink.
If you are the impatient type who stands by the printer while it prints you may throw it out the window!
I promise you, it will occur to you that maybe it is broken as it spends minutes making all sorts of noises.
There is a part of me that is like that, but I calm myself by reminding myself that I'm not paying $100 each time I have to replace the full set of inks.

What to do without professional help - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) So far it is okay but we had to have a professional help up with the set up....still not sure about everything.
It does use a lot of ink cartridges compared to other brands
nice printer - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) did not get 5 stars as canon does not support my new windows phone.
otherwise good printer and much quieter than my previous kodak.
The biggest reason is that the older model is quieter and, overall, just as fast as the newer MX922.
Yes, the MX922 can be noisy and subject to long pauses when printing.
The old MX870 is quiet, smooth, and a steady worker compared to the MX922.
The MX922 does a nice, quiet job printing directly to CDs.
We have printed literally hundreds of CDs on HP White Matte Ink Jet discs.
Was fairly easy to set up.
It has a quiet mode which is very quiet and it it is fairly fast.
It uses a lot of ink compared to other printers that I have had even though it is set to draft mode.
Clearly it uses all the ink, all the time, which is a little costly compared to the HP it replaced.
I would not buy this printer again and would probably go back to an HP.
It is the biggest ink hog of any printer that we have ever owned.

Looked nice sounded nice BUT the first one I got didn't work, got a code 6000 paper jam code, before I could get to putting in the cartridges, called Canon they couldn't help me all they wanted to do was send me a reconditioned printer!

Bought at a great price. - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I have not owned the printer too long as of yet and this a replacement for a 892.
I like the fact it holds more paper, prints better (although slower) Also scans very slow compared to the 892.

I bought it because it was so highly rated by PC Magazine.
uses a lot of ink - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Nice pictures, but uses a lot of ink and very expensive.

print quality is nice, but it is unbelievably slow - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) too slow to actually use in most cases.

Excellent price - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) The price that I paid for this device is, indeed, very good because it has a lot of features: it has a wireless module, it can print pictures at a good quality and it also features a scanner and a copier.
It's a bit noisy, it vibrates while working and it also jams the photo paper from time to time.
Still, this was a good deal.

Very pleased, good shipping as well - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Printing is great, has just about everything needed in small office printing environment.

Avoid - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Clunky,unresponsive,slow,loud.Hard to believe Canon produced this.
This makes great prints. - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) If you want to print photos, this will do a very good job.

great all in one printer I would buy another one - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Once it is set up,It works perfect and I would call canon for tech support ,Its free they will help you with the wifi some times your wifi is not working and needs repaired for this unit
I wouldn't recommend - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Took 2 days to get up & running.

Prints very nicely; warmup takes minutes - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) I print and scan both plain paper copies and full-color photos using this printer, and the results are very nice.
took a bit of time to figure out how to set it up.
The price and features of this printer were very attractive, so I purchased one.

My initial impressions are: Print quality is good, but you probably need to put the setting on High Quality, the scanner works fine if you want to scan to a printer, but I cannot seem to get it to scan to a USB drive (it keeps complaining that a drive is not inserted), and my biggest disappointment is the speed.
But, for the price, I suppose one cannot expect much more.

Failed to deliver - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Purchased the PIXMA MX922 based on the reviews and I was looking for a dependable wifi capable printer.
In short this is difficult to set up with instructions that are unclear.
It jammed during set up and a call to their help line led to no help.
It would not work with my other devices (iPad and iPhone) even with support from the "we print" app customer help desk.
Additionally when it did print it was so loud!
Fax function is much easier than many MFunction machines, all setups and menus are useful.
Wireless connection has been flawless and easy with 3 different home computers.
Ink use is quite reduced by using "XL" carts, even the generic brands.
Easy to set up, and easy to use.
This is my first canon printer, I had purchased mostly Epson and Lexmark and I am not disappointed in this printer.

Be prepared: No Manual or Rear Paper Feed for envelopes, labels, etc. - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) This is my 3rd Canon printer -- it operates much like the prior printers in terms of printing, scanning and faxing.
Then, unload the paper, resize the tray, load envelopes, and then print the envelopes.
I took another star off because the ink cartridges have gotten even smaller and this thing is LOUD compared to my other Canon all-in-ones.
Good value for the money!
- Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) Price plus features!
I wanted an air printer that was compatible with my iPad as I can work from home now with so much more ease!
I have printed over a hundred 4x6 pictures, 500 sheets of copy paper and 75 envelops and still haven't change the ink cartridges so the ink last longer then my other printers and I like that.
Good printer, good price, one drawback - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) This multifunction printer works well.
Print, copy, scan functions seem quite good.
Amazon price definitely is good.
But overall, a decent printer for the price.

Good MFC - Canon PIXMA MX922 Wireless Color Photo Printer with Scanner, Copier and Fax (Office Product) We were concerned about some reviews that said picture quality may not be as good as it could be.
The Apple app and Air Print work well.
Its a noisy printer, but will take the noise, at this point the picture quality is worth a little noise.
Had some trouble setting up the printer with drivers downloaded from Canon.
I got it for such a great deal even if it didn't work, buying ink for my old one would have cost more!!
It is a bit noisy at start up but I don't use it when I am trying to sleep:) It prints quietly.
Takes up a big space but I have a spot for it:) I love it is has wifi capability, works awesome!
I also had to replace the ink tank since it finished kind of quickly and the print quality of the new ink tank is just horrible (although it is the original canon ink).
